title.narrative: Influencing Policy for Sustainable Gold Landscapes in Ghana

description.narrative: In Ghana, Solidaridad continued supporting the empowerment of Ghana National Association of Small Scale Miners (GNASSM), the Artisanal and Small Scale Miners Africa Network (ASSMAN) and the Women in Mining (WIM) on effective governance and management, effective grassroots advocacy and inclusive policy formulation and gender mainstreaming. We also continued strengthening the capacity of the Responsible Mining Network (ReMNET) members in sustainable gold mining practices, and providing advice to relevant governmental institutions at national and local levels. The advice in 2019 was focused on promoting responsible and sustainable practices in small scale mines, recategorization of mining, reducing the duration of acquiring small scale mining licences, and implementation of the Multilateral Mining Integrated Programme (MMIP).
